channel.title: Problem with new Graphics card
channel.description:
I just got a cheap Inno3D 8600GT off the net and i'm having trouble installing it.
I've put it in my PC, disabled my on-board graphics and enabled the PCI-Express slot. Now, I get a little yellow ? in the icons bar with "Video Controller (VGA Compatible)". When I go to install the latest drivers from the Inno3D website, I get a message saying that no hardware in my system is compatible with these drivers.
The weird thing is, just as I turn on my PC, even before Windows starts-up, I get a screen that gives me all the info on the graphics card.
Any help...PLEASE? :) [size=14pt] [SOLVED][/size] Solution - Had to manually install the drivers through a modded .inf

item.title: Problem with new Graphics card
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I just got a cheap Inno3D 8600GT off the net and i’m having trouble installing it.

I’ve put it in my PC, disabled my on-board graphics and enabled the PCI-Express slot. Now, I get a little yellow ? in the icons bar with “Video Controller (VGA Compatible)”. When I go to install the latest drivers from the Inno3D website, I get a message saying that no hardware in my system is compatible with these drivers.

The weird thing is, just as I turn on my PC, even before Windows starts-up, I get a screen that gives me all the info on the graphics card.

Any help…PLEASE?
[size=14pt]
[SOLVED][/size]
Solution - Had to manually install the drivers through a modded .inf

Read full topic
